title: This Fed Nominee Will Cost You at the Pump
sub_head: Sarah Bloom Raskin’s confirmation would be the culmination of a two-decade offensive by the left to strand carbon assets.
body:
Sarah Bloom Raskin’s confirmation as the Federal Reserve Board’s vice chair for supervision would be the culmination of a two-decade offensive by the left to strand carbon assets (“Sarah Raskin’s Systemic Risk,” Review & Outlook, Feb. 4).
Al Gore has preached in Journal op-eds that sustainable capitalism requires aggressive defunding of the oil industry. The idea was that the overarching climate crisis would prompt an energy transition that would make fossil-fuel assets in the ground worthless. The not-yet-reached goal was to convince investors that holding oil and gas stocks was a loser’s game.
